verbose_text: There are two types of plasminogen deficiency : (1) hypoplasminogenemia (Type I PLG deficiency), in which there is a marked decrease in the levels of PLG antigen < = 1.9 mg/dL (normal range 6 to 25 mg/dL) and functional activity of up to 33% (normal range 80 to 120%), and (2) dysplasminogenemia (Type II PLG deficiency), in which the level of immunoreactive PLG is within normal range but the specific activity of PLG is reduced [XREF_BIBR - XREF_BIBR].
